meanings.definition: The condition of having both male and female reproductive organs on the same plant.
meanings.sent1: Monoecy allows a plant to reproduce without needing another plant nearby.
meanings.sent2: In monoecy, a single plant can produce both seeds and pollen.
meanings.sent3: The garden was full of monoecy, making it a self-sufficient ecosystem.
meanings.sent4: The concept of monoecy in plants is like having a one-stop shop for reproduction.
meanings.sent5: Monoecy simplifies plant reproduction by combining male and female parts in one organism.

meanings.sent1: Monoecy is common in certain plant species where each individual has both types of reproductive organs.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the benefits of monoecy helps in studying plant diversity.
meanings.sent3: The monoecy of the forest plants amused the botanist as he observed their unique characteristics.
meanings.sent4: The unity of monoecy in plants symbolizes balance and harmony in nature.
meanings.sent5: The monoecy of the flowers made them stand out in the botanical garden.
